title: [bug] AppImage fails to run due to misguided "validation"

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/commit/6fbd6dba5290dc017ab0ba5a44cf4358b022836f ("validate AppImage execution when env vars are set") introduces a "validation" that makes unreasonable assumptions, and as a result the AppImage does not work as it should:

```
thread 'main' panicked at '`APPDIR` or `APPIMAGE` environment variable found but this application was not detected as an AppImage; this might be a security issue.', (...)
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

References:
* https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/7046
* https://github.com/AppImage/appimage.github.io/pull/3242
* https://github.com/AppImage/appimage.github.io/pull/3263
* https://github.com/lencx/ChatGPT/issues/308
* https://github.com/spyglass-search/spyglass/issues/491
* https://github.com/OzymandiasTheGreat/emoji-keyboard/issues/69
* https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/5637

### Reproduction

* Try to run the AppImage using [Firejail](https://firejail.wordpress.com/documentation-2/appimage-support/)
* Extract the AppImage to an AppDir using `--appimage-extract`, then run it using `./squashfs-root/AppRun`

### Expected behavior

The application runs.

### Platform and versions

```text
I can't run commands; the result is from an automated test that can be seen at the URL below.
```


### Stack trace

```text
https://github.com/AppImage/appimage.github.io/actions/runs/6060923178/job/16445575611#step:4:386
```


### Additional context

Nothing in the AppImageSpec suggests or guarantees that an AppImage gets mounted to a mountpoint of any sort of predictable path. Just because one particular version of the AppImage runtime had a certain behavior it cannot be deduced that this is universally true; e.g., when using Firejail it is not.
